title: @ RIOT, Permabans in general
body:
Riot should allow a permabanned player to appeal the ban after a year passes, through support. Perhaps undergo an evaluation of some kind. I understand that the things said to get to a permanent ban are usually horrific, however, a lot can change in a years time. People mature, things in their life can change

You dont know if the person that was being toxic constantly had an abusive family, got picked on in school every day, ect. Its not an excuse to be toxic, but... its just my opinion, and I stand by it.

Good day, and if any of you happen to read this, thanks for your time.

(Yes I have been permabanned before, I will be completely out in the air with my bias. I am not perfect, I still rage sometimes, however, I haven't had a single chat restriction in 5 months. The occurrences have gone down, and the severity is mostly just calling the off person every 10th game a dick for harassing me, before I promptly mute.)

I remember that Riot tried a system  a few years back that gave permabanned players a shot at getting their account back. It was called the 'level 20 challenge'. Basically, if a toxic player could level an account up to 20 without hitting the tribunal even once, they were supposed to get their permabanned account back. Supposedly the amount of players that reformed out of the ones that were picked was roughly 5%. It seems highly unlikely that they would   attempt a similar program when the results the first time around were so miserable. Unless they feel like chancing it again, your permanent ban is exactly as it reads; permanent.

If you want to do some more research on this past system of theirs, I'd recommend doing a search for 'Level 20 Challenge'. You can also take a look at this link and skip down to number 33.
http://www.reignofgaming.net/redtracker/topic/75596-tribunal-faq-updated-18-06

Permanent Ban. PERMANENT. No take backs. Ever. The only exception is a false ban, and that rarely happens. People can change, yes- but you cannot run from consequences. A year ban is more or less the same as a permanent- you just get your account back. What's to stop a person from playing on smurfs the whole year and buy nothing, then immediately get on their account again?
It's Riot's punishment system- The Permanent ban means you either fucked up REALLY badly or you were constantly being a "yappy dog" that wouldn't shut up no matter how many times you sprayed it or hit it on the nose.
Riot wanted to break that reputation they had to attract newer players to the game.
